intro: Xanthosia pilosa var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features slender, erect stems with opposite, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are clustered in racemes and produce small, capsule-like fruits.
